ovdesc.p: The CHANGE.PRODUCT Property Class is used by all products which allow for a change of product during their lifecycle. When a new product is applied onto the existing arrangement, the user would lose all his negotiations done as part of the old product. This table allows a list of products to which the old product can change and also define time-scales as to when the event would happen.

There are some property classes which do not apply onto the arrangement when the change product happens. Currently these are : TERM.AMOUNT, CUSTOMER, ACCOUNT and LIMIT classes. The properties of these classes would continue with their running conditions and would not be affected by change product event.

During the automatic generation of Change product date, the Date Convention and Business day center settings indicate the action which will be taken if the derived date is a non-working day. There are four Date Convention options:
• Backward – the change product date will move backward to the previous working day.
• Forward – the change product date will move forward to the next working day.

• Forward Same Month – the change product date will move forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month, it will move backward to the previous working day.
• Calendar – the change product date will not move even if it is a non-working day.
Input allowed are BACKWARD, FORWARD, FORWARD SAME MONTH or CALENDAR.
If nothing is specified at the arrangement, CALENDAR would be defaulted
Would be ignored if a specific date is stated in CHANGE.DATE

When a period or date is stated, the change product event happens on that day. But a value may be stated in this field which would run the event 'n' days prior to the change product so that the user can negotiate the terms on the new product.

For example, if a change product event is scheduled to run on 01-May and prior days is stated as 5, then the change product event 'runs' on 26-April 'effective' 01-May. When no prior day is stated, then the system 'runs' and 'effects' the product change on 01-May.
Numeric field indicating days.
Maximum of 3 characters.
